entry.def: When a political leader reshuffles the ministers in a government, he or she changes their jobs so that some of the ministers change their responsibilities.

example.ex: The prime minister told reporters this morning that he plans to reshuffle his entire cabinet.
example.tran: 今天早上，首相告诉记者他打算全面改组内阁。

sentences.en: He reshuffled the cabinet to firm his government.
sentences.cn: 他重新改组内阁以巩固其政府。

sentences.en: The prime minister reshuffled his Cabinet yesterday.
The Prime Minister announced a reshuffle of his Cabinet.
The former minister was relieved of his post in last month’s extensive government reshuffle.
sentences.cn: 在上个月的政府全面改组中，前任部长被解职了。

sentences.en: The newspaper’s account of the so-called reshuffle of the financial ministry was a complete fiction.
sentences.cn: 报纸对所谓的财政部人事改组的报道完全是捏造的。
